meaning: Originally, a stick; now specifically, a long and slender piece of metal or (especially) wood, used for various construction or support purposes.
example: Huck Finn poled that raft southward down the Mississippi because going northward against the current was too much work.

meaning: A substance used to polish.
example: A good silver polish will remove tarnish easily.

meaning: To polish; to refine; to render polite.
example: It's not polite to use a mobile phone in a restaurant.

meaning: To make something harmful, especially by the addition of some unwanted product.
example: The factory polluted the river when it cleaned its tanks.

meaning: In a poor manner or condition; without plenty, or sufficiency, or suitable provision for comfort.
example: to live poorly

meaning: A snack food made from corn/maize kernels popped by dry heating.
The quality or state of being popular; especially, the state of being esteemed by, or of being in favor with, the people at large
example: Politicians are rarely known for their popularity.

meaning: A portable building used for temporary purposes, particularly:
example: a portable pension plan

meaning: A case for carrying papers, drawings, photographs, maps and other flat documents.
example: I would like to introduce you to our portfolio of services.

meaning: The charge for posting an item.
Relating to the collection, sorting and delivery of mail.
example: for all your postal needs

meaning: A rectangular piece of thick paper or thin cardboard intended to be written on and mailed without an envelope. In the case of a picture postcard one side carries a picture or photograph.
example: to postcard one's friends

meaning: A picture of a celebrity, an event etc., intended to be attached to a wall.
example: He has posters of his favorite band, sports teams and holiday resorts up.

meaning: To delay or put off an event, appointment etc.
Fired ceramic wares that contain clay when formed.
example: The shelves were lined with pottery of all shapes and sizes.

meaning: Brief editorial preface (usually to an article or essay)
example: Cultural genocide precedes physical genocide.

meaning: A statement of what will happen in the future.
A preparation for a main matter; an introduction.
example: These are just the preliminary results.

meaning: A prize or award.
To order (a drug or medical device) for use by a particular patient (under licensed authority).
example: The doctor prescribed aspirin.

meaning: The act of prescribing a rule, law, etc..
example: "Jurisdiction to prescribe" is a state's authority to make its laws applicable to certain persons or activities. -- Richard G. Alexander, Iran and Libya Sanctions Act of 1996: Congress exceeds its jurisdiction to prescribe law. Washington and Lee Law Review, 1997.

meaning: Someone who presents a broadcast programme; a compere or master of ceremonies.
Of high prestige.
example: She has a prestigious job with an international organization.

meaning: An experience of something in advance.
Something that is likely.
example: It's probable that it will rain tomorrow.

meaning: Capable of producing something, especially in abundance; fertile.
example: a productive set

meaning: The state of being productive, fertile or efficient
example: You can see the computer age everywhere but in the productivity statistics.

meaning: As a professional; for one's paid career.
example: Steve Davis plays snooker professionally.

meaning: Ability, skill, competence.
example: a test of proficiency in English

meaning: Producing a profit.
One who writes computer programs; a software developer.
To forbid, disallow, or proscribe officially; to make illegal or illicit.
example: The restaurant prohibits smoking on the patio.

meaning: Something which projects, protrudes, juts out, sticks out, or stands out.
example: The face of the cliff had many projections that were big enough for birds to nest on.

meaning: Someone who devises or suggests a project; a proposer or planner of something.
Standing out, or projecting; jutting; protuberant
An advertising promotion
example: Collect five promotional vouchers to claim your prize.

meaning: In prompt manner; both soon and quickly.
To check a written text for errors in spelling and grammar.
The scene before or around, in time or in space; view; prospect.
example: I'm meeting the prospectives at 3.

meaning: Something that protects.
example: Mother bears are famously protective of their cubs.

meaning: One who, or that which, provides a service, commodity, or the means for subsistence.
Advertising or other activity designed to rouse public interest in something.
To make widely known to the public.
example: The scandal was so publicised that he lost the next election.

meaning: To issue (something, such as printed work) for distribution and/or sale.
example: Most of the sketches Faulkner published in 1925 appeared in the Sunday magazine section of the New Orleans Times-Picayune.

meaning: Prompt; on time.
